references.paper_title: A fast and elitist multiobjective genetic algorithm: NSGA-II
references.reason: This paper introduced NSGA-II, a highly influential multiobjective evolutionary algorithm that is frequently used as a baseline for comparison in many MOO studies.

references.paper_title: MOEA/D: A multiobjective evolutionary algorithm based on decomposition
references.reason: This paper introduced MOEA/D, another highly influential decomposition-based multiobjective evolutionary algorithm that forms the basis of many subsequent decomposition-based approaches.

references.paper_title: SMS-EMOA: Multiobjective selection based on dominated hypervolume
references.reason: This paper introduced SMS-EMOA, a prominent algorithm using the hypervolume indicator for selection, which is a widely used metric for assessing the quality of multiobjective optimization results.

references.paper_title: Normal-boundary intersection: A new method for generating the Pareto surface in nonlinear multicriteria optimization problems
references.reason: This paper proposed the Normal Boundary Intersection method, a well-known technique for generating a well-distributed set of Pareto optimal solutions.

references.paper_title: Maximin design on non hypercube domains and kernel interpolation
references.reason: This paper presented theoretical results related to maximin designs, which are highly relevant to the paper's focus on generating uniformly distributed points on the Pareto front.
